basel_Ca: Eagle with Basel Crosier, Single-Headed, C.a.

Watermark C.a. can be distinguished by three features: its eagle has segmented wings that point upward, a protruding tongue, and a body intersected by two chain lines (marked with red).

________________________________________________________________________

This watermark can be found on the following prints:

  • Self-portrait in a soft hat and patterned cloak, 1631, British Museum, London.

NOTE: This is a quarto sized print, meaning it was printed on one-quarter of a full sheet of paper.

(Erik Hinterding, Rembrandt as an Etcher, 2006, II, 106)
